paper_abstract: We solve the minimization problem for finitely axiomatizable theories in Godel infinite-valued propositional logic. That is, we obtain an algorithm that when input a formula alpha(X(1),...,X(n)) outputs a formula beta(X(1),...,X(m)) such that (i) the theories singly axiomatized by {alpha} and {beta} have isomorphic algebraic semantics, and (ii) if beta'(X(1),...,X(m')) is any formula satisfying (i), then m'>= m.
paper_title: Computing Minimal Axiomatizations in Godel Propositional Logic
